result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachel N Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to submit a DNA sample prior to release from custody.
Court waives all costs.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachel N Howard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Check request sent to finance department for payment of attorney fees - $35.00 - Attorney Weil.
Copies forwarded to defendant, defendant's atty, and DA
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: for payment of attorney fees - forwarded to branch

Defendant Rachel N Howard in court, in custody.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the criminal complaint.  Court refers defendant to the State Public Defender to recall case later this afternoon.
2:27 pm case recalled.  Defendant appears in person with attorney Matt Weil, as court appointed counsel.  Defendant appears in Custody.  Patti Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  Defendant enters a plea of Guilty.  State recommends 7 days jail.  Court reviews plea waiver with defendant.  Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty.  Court imposes a sentence of 7 days in the county jail with credit for 7 days.  Defendant to submit to DNA sample before release.  Court waives all costs.
conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Rachel N Howard appears by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel appearing as a friend of the court, waives reading. Defendant does not wish to be represented by public defender. State requests $100 cash bail with conditions. Court sets bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant

Defendant Rachel N Howard not in court. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds probable cause and will issue an arrest warrant.
